reviews.text: Extra large slices available.  Not just a novelty, the slices are actually quality.

Chicken bacon ranch was excellent.  I went back for a huge roni slice, but my friends misheard my mumbles and brought me a pepperoni roll. :( I ate it and it was excellent, and then they brought me a pepperoni slice gratis.  I couldn't be more impressed.

Koronet Pizza ‚Äì The BIGGEST & BEST Slice in NYC üçïüî•

Let me tell you Koronet Pizza has the largest slices I‚Äôve ever seen in New York City üò≠üçï! Like literally, one slice could feed you for breakfast, lunch, and dinner (and I‚Äôm not exaggerating lol).

I ordered a cheesy slice, and the flavor was everything perfectly crisp on the edges, soft in the middle, and loaded with that real NY pizza taste. It was so good that I‚Äôm already craving another one today.

The vibe inside feels classic New York chill, cozy, and unpretentious. It‚Äôs the kind of spot that makes you feel like you‚Äôre in on one of the city‚Äôs best-kept secrets.

If you‚Äôre in the mood for that true NYC slice experience go to Koronet Pizza. Come hungry‚Ä¶ because these slices are next-level huge and absolutely delicious üòãüçï

#KoronetPizza #NYCPizza #FoodieFinds #BiggestSliceInNYC #PizzaLovers #NYCEats #Ciciamoreats

Koronet Pizza
2848 Broadway
New York, NY 10025

All√° Vodka with Basil Jumbo Slice

What drew me to this urban pizza is the enormous size of their slices.  It‚Äôs definitely a unique experience being served a whopping 16‚Äù slice that envelopes the entire tray!

#koronetpizza #jumboslice #allavodkawithbasil

I went here by recommendation of a family member. Started eating my slice waiting for my family slice when i noticed rodents. These slices arent cheap. Customer service was terrible. Won't do this again and family that recommended can't recommend anymore restaurants. Rodents üêÅüê≠‚Ä¶
I didn't want to leave. The pizza was incredibly.

This place is great. It's a good, reliable slice shop. I just need to let them and everyone know that I had their eggplant slice and it was not just the worst thing I've had there but it was the worst thing I've ever had from a pizzeria anywhere. I wanted to whisper to the slice "blink twice if you need help." Whatever they do to their eggplant and the sauce they put on top was just so acidic and strange tasting.
For context, a few blocks north at Trufa, the eggplant slice is their BEST slice by far. It's not really on their menu I don't think, but when I see they're serving it, I get it. I was hoping this would be that. From the first bite I knew I made a big mistake.

But otherwise, koronet has never done me wrong so this isn't a bad post just a critique to play to their strengths
Jumbo pizza was good and pretty competitive with some of the top pizza in NYC, its proximity to Columbia makes it a good destination for professors and students alike!
Great NY slice.
I had a regular pepperoni bacon slice. The crust is nice and I liked how the bacon bits aren't the chewy ones.
The employee are rude  don‚Äôt recommend the employee ruin the experience of getting a good pizza
A legendary IMMENSE slice!
Unreal pizza for a great price. $6 for the large slice which is probably the size of 2.5 slices. I thought the quality wouldn‚Äôt be as good but it was great.
Really good pizza and the price is good.... Got the big big pizza
My first time and I loved it. üòç
Great NY pizza! Visited here on a trip to NY. Pizza was HUGE and freshly made!
Good lord this is a bigass slice. Great pizza. The epitome of new York style pizza. Drop NY grab a slice sit outside and watch the city.
Dry and underwhelming.
Absolutely fantastic! A perfect example of why NYC pizza is the best in the country!!!

Their main gimmick is the large pizza slice. The price is a bit high for a large slice at $6.25 as it's basically the size of 2 normal slices. Flavorwise, the pizza is horrifically salty!!! If you have high blood pressure, stay away... if you don't, you'll wind up with high blood pressure! The salty pizza was disgusting! I can only recommend this place to SALT lovers but if you have NORMAL taste buds, you'll hate this pizza. Trust me on this and DON'T find out the hard way!

Good pizza at decent price. Convenient to just sit down and get a (huge) slice.

Just wish they can label all the different kinds of pizza so I can order easier.
Fast service. Plenty of choice. The jumbo slices are really huge and 1 normal slice was enough for me. My wife couldn‚Äôt finish her jumbo slice. No public restroom.
I am sorry but I could not eat it. The slice cost 9$ and is huge. Unfortunately it‚Äôs the worst pizza that I‚Äôve ever eaten. Basically you‚Äôre just eating grease.
Slices are way expensive for no reason. Customer service is lacking.
My XL slice was tasty I'm going back for a Margherita Pizza.
goat
Could be better. Barely any sauce on their pizza. Not enough flavor.

yum
13" long by 5" in width for an area of 33"
HUGE slice for only $6.00. I only had one large slice and i was stuffed. The pizza was tasty. Well with the trip to give it a try. I'll be back.
JUMBO PIZZA SLICE?!
ÈùíÊò•„ÅÆÂë≥ÔºÅ

Indoors, this is purely a takeout spot, but they are kind enough to have outdoor seating. We went yesterday and the Pizza is literally the size. Love your torso, but it's not just big. It tastes really good.I would go back and make this a staple for when friends and family come to visit NYC! Thanks Koronet!
Super jumbo slices cool atmosphere, good pizza
Loved the Margherita and regular cheese. The jumbo slice is huuugeee. The crust has a bite to it. Crunchy. Great pizza!
Go to spot for pizza when im in Harlem !!!
Satisfying. One serving is big enough to share.
It is just on the exit of the subway 1; standard pizza

The big slices are filing and delicious.  There's better pizza out there but this kinda fits a great little (or big) niche. Pricey but good. This is not Koronet from the past. lol. It's still big but now it's Good üëçüèæ
Koronet Pizza has been around for a long time. This is the only pizzeria that offers super size slices.
Sabri broke up with meüòî‚Ä¶
Always tasty with just enough cheese and sauce and the temperature is always great

Tasty pizza by the slice place! It‚Äôs open late night and great for the late night pizza place. The slices look a lot smaller in the display and are quite large. A bit pricey per slice, but they‚Äôre delicious and you get a lot of pizza each one.
I don‚Äôt know why they call it the ‚ÄúJUMBO‚Äù pizza anynore . This is so tiny , better off getting across the street at famiglia
Very nice pizza here and a very kind store. Wonderful experience would definitely come back again.
The truth.

If this pizza was any more heavenly it would be served in the Cathedral around the corner. Famous for their JUMBO slices, modestly priced I might add, this tiny pizzeria serves some of the best pizza you‚Äôll find anywhere on the upper Westside. It‚Äôs not always easy to grab an open stool and watch the  Broadway Avenue crowds pass by, so just walk and eat it. You won‚Äôt make a mess; after tasting the sauce, you won‚Äôt wanna drop a bit.

Very sketchy behavior of the employees‚Ä¶. Honestly I usually like the pizza but when you come at night be careful they try to sell you things you don‚Äôt want. I asked for a regular cheese slice and they tried to charge me for a jumbo slice that is twice the regular slice price. Then, when I asked what‚Äôs going on, they suddenly said they don‚Äôt have regular cheese slices, while at the same time I see them taking a regular slice from below the counter to add pepperoni on it for someone else. They just lost a customer for being too greedy‚Ä¶
A CLASSIC UWS establishment - long live koronet

Estava procurando algo bom custo benef√≠cio para comer, e principalmente levar bom parque. Essa pizza foi um achado.
Exagerei e comprei o tamanho Jumbo, confesso que era mais do que necess√°rio para uma pessoa. O tamanho normal j√° √© maior que as fatias de pizza no Brasil.

A pizza estava muito boa. Foi esquentada no forno na hora que pedi e consegui levar para o parque. Valeu a pena.

Several options, speedy service and best of all: delicious.

There was a decent crowd when I went in, but I had virtually no wait before I had a slice in hand. I also went back on a Saturday afternoon to order a slice as big as my head, and it did not disappoint. I'd recommend sharing it with a friend, but it's delicious on your own as well.

Compared to other pizza by the slice, I think Koronet has the best crust and sauce, putting it a slice above the rest for a similar cost. Underrated and delicious.

Koronet Pizza on the Upper West Side is an absolute must-visit if you‚Äôre looking for giant, delicious slices! These are hands-down the biggest pizza slices in NYC, and they don‚Äôt just rely on size‚Äîthey‚Äôre perfectly balanced too. Each slice has just the right amount of sauce, cheese, and toppings, with a dough that‚Äôs soft yet firm enough to hold up to its massive size. Whether you‚Äôre in the mood for a classic cheese slice or something with toppings, Koronet‚Äôs pizzas always hit the spot without being overwhelming. It‚Äôs the perfect blend of flavor and portion, making it a go-to for a true New York pizza experience!

Just a guy on a bike riding around throughout NYC eating pizza.
8/10
Cheese 2.5/3
Sauce 2.5/3
Crust 2/3
Price 1/1
Definitely worth it. 3 slices for the price of 2 $6. You can‚Äôt beat that nowadays in NYC.

20 year staple for my taste buds
Jumbo New York Style Slices and open on the late night have been very consistent for years. I recommend to all visitors of NYC‚Ä¶

This is one of the biggest slices I ever had. One slice is definitely good for 1 person (almost $8 slice). Their spinach and broccoli slice, and margarita slice is great. We were 3 of us and able to share 2 slices. Definitely worth visiting again.
The jumbo slice is something you have to try at least once. It's very good but the size of it is what's astounding. It's the size of an entire pizza. Lol. And it's quite good too

The jumbo slice is the biggest I‚Äôve ever seen. I didn‚Äôt like this place at first, but it‚Äôs grown on me a lot. I definitely recommend the jumbo slice; the grandma pan pizza wasn‚Äôt as good. Props for being one of the latest-open places on this stretch of Broadway.

The biggest pizza slice in NYC. And tastes great also! The thin huuuuge slice does justice someone who grew up in New York City and loves this pizza more than pizza in Italy! Crust is chewy and light and it‚Äôs ultra thin to not feel guilty eating all of it. Will return anytime I can. The grandmas is done just right with chewy and crispy and flavors that make you super happy. Staff is nice and friendly! Always adds to the great experience. You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

We just stumbled upon the biggest pizza slice in NYC! This slice is literally the size of your head and we couldn't believe our eyes when we saw it. But let's talk about the most important thing - the taste! The crust on this slice is crispy on the outside, giving you that satisfying crunch with every bite, and perfectly chewy on the inside, which makes it satisfying to sink your teeth into. And the toppings were fresh, flavorful, and generously portioned.  Now, we won't go so far as to say that this is the absolute best pizza in New York - after all, the competition is pretty stiff - but we can definitely vouch for the fact that these slices are fantastic and offer great value for money. You can even share it between two people and still be left feeling completely satisfied. This pizza place is a popular haunt for Columbia University students and it's not hard to see why. If you're in the mood for a massive slice of deliciousness, this is definitely the place to be!

We came in from Texas and this place comes recommended. Pizza bigger than your face. Perfect combination of crisp and flop. All the toppings (oregano, parm, garlic, and more) on the tables. Just the right amount of cheese. Wasn‚Äôt the toppings of choice but highly recommend.

It‚Äôs a small pizza shop but nothing beats a jumbo sliced pizza. We tried pepperoni and chicken Alfredo. They were both really good. I liked the thin crust as well. This was my after school stop when I was in college. The flavor has been consistent over the years.
A perfect place to fill up for cheap when exploring the Big Apple! My friends and I love their jumbo slices!

Who would know better than a Columbia women‚Äôs basketball coach where to find a good slice of pizza!?!??  We got a recommendation to try Koronet Pizza, which is right down the street from Columbia University. It was great. HUGE barely describes the size of a jumbo slice that is very reasonably priced. If you try to eat more than one slice, you may not be able to move! I definitely recommend giving it a try if you find yourself in the upper west side of Manhattan!

The best pizza in the Columbia University area. Giant slices that are excellent. Cheese is fresh, sauce is delicious and crust is great. One large slice will do it. Small place that‚Äôs not overly fancy but the pizza more than makes up for the atmosphere.

I had a fantastic experience at Koronet Pizza! The pizza was absolutely delicious - the crust was crispy on the outside and perfectly chewy on the inside, and the toppings were fresh and flavorful. The staff were all incredibly friendly and attentive, and they made us feel right at home. The atmosphere of the store was cozy and welcoming, and I appreciated the attention to cleanliness and hygiene. Overall, I highly recommend Koronet Pizza to anyone in the area who is looking for a great slice of pizza. It's clear that they take pride in their food and their customer service, and it really shows.

Huge pizza!! The pizza, sauce and sides tastes great. There's place to sit and enjoy your food. For 5$ for a plain slice it's super filling. They also have a great selection of toppings as well as a nicely remodeled restaurant in which to eat your slice in.
This is the biggest slice of pizza in New york ,for $7.75, it's well worth it. You can share this slice and be full, you won't want anything else to eat for the rest of the day and oh boy is it GOOD.

Pretty popular pizza place close to Columbia University.  Pizza crust is pretty thin and good.  Their slices are pretty large and have good topping selection for vegetarians. Pics show sicilian and grandma slices. I wish they add eggplant parmesan topping as an option to make it more enticing to pizza lovers, especially being a popular NYC pizzeria.

I had the jumbo slice of cheese the last time I ate here a week ago.
These guys don‚Äôt mess around!

This pizza is amazing.

Koronet is setting the bar pretty high here. This is about as New York slice as it gets. üçï

Finally got a chance to get to this place with the giant slices. Overall the pizza is good, not the best, but not bad by any means.  The slices are huge and 1 slice will fill you up. Good ratios of sauce to cheese and a good crust.  Check em out at least once.  Giant slice with sausage and bottle of soda was 11 bucks.

Its a pizza shop so you can't expect fine dining atmosphere; though wiped down tables would have been better.  The pizza however was yummy, especially the classic margherita.  The jumbo slices are ENORMOUS.  They boast the largest pizza in NYC and I believe that it must be true!  Price point was fair for a giant slice in the city.  $6.00 for jumbos.  In the midst of Columbia U campus property so very conveniently located as well.  Definitely a thumbs up to Koronet!

I hate coming here because the pizza is soooo good. How can you go wrong with a sausage and pepperoni super slice? I work near a pizza shop, let's just say I get on a train to come here . So good I had to get two more to take home.  If you are anywhere around Columbia University you must check this spot out . It is definitely a hidden gem ,

Went here yesterday with my mom and my baby after her appointment and let me say this pizzeria has the best pizza ever it was huge , the flavor was amazing the cheese is extremely delicious, i really enjoyed it so did my mom and my baby‚Ä¶

Pizza tipica americana. Viene venduta al trancio e ci sono due misure: piccolo e grande. La fetta grande √® quasi equivalente ad una pizza in Italia. La pizza √® buona e il servizio veloce. All'interno ci sono dei tavoli con gli sgabelli dove poter mangiare. Buona esperienza!

I tried regular size slices of the margherita and spinach & ricotta. Both were loaded with toppings. The margherita was generously sauced and tasted great. The spinach & ricotta was missing something to make the flavour pop. Appreciated how‚Ä¶

If you're a lover of thin crust pizza this is the place to go. Perfectly greasy and delicious.

They have two size of pizza slices typically, 'small' which is what most people would refer to as a normal slice and jumbo which is a massive slice of pizza. Paid $15 for two slices and two drinks, both of us were very satisfied

Prob√© la pizza jumbo de pepperoni y me dej√≥ bastante sorprendido que el sabor fuese en general bueno, estas pizzas tienen la fama de ser las primeras jumbo desde el 81 en NY, aunque no soy seguidor del dicho "the bigger the better" tienen un excelente sabor costo/beneficio. La salsa sabe a jitomate y unas cuantas hierbas (la mayor√≠a usa pur√© y salsas enlatadas); el pepperoni tiene m√°s grasa que gordita nadando en cazo de carnitas , mientras come una paleta de manteca rebosada en chocolate blanco con cubierta de tocino.
PD. Si regresar√≠a, los precios comienzan desde $5.25 por la 'jumbo cheese pizza", as√≠ que se convierte en una opci√≥n econ√≥mica despu√©s de la 100 st. y antes de Harlem.
